comments:
This is on 3.3RC1 on MacOS X. I can't reproduce this on Windows.

Although this problem is only reproducible (as far as I know) using the cheat sheet, it may have be a problem with the context help or the Update Site Project Wizard itself.

1) Begin the "Create an Update Site" cheat sheet, part of the "Creating a plug-in" composite cheat sheet. 
2) Complete the Introduction and opening of the Plug-in Development Perspective. 
3) The first sub-step under "Create the Update Site" can be done automatically. 
4) Click on the link to perform this action. The Update Site Project Wizard should open with a context help displaying the cheat sheet beside the window.
5) Click Cancel. The window clears (except for some labels), but does not disappear. An SWTException is logged.

An example log:

eclipse.buildId=I20070517-1700
java.version=1.5.0_07
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=x86, WS=carbon, NL=en_US

Command-line arguments:  -os macosx -ws carbon -arch x86 -startup /Users/eclipse/Desktop/Noam/eclipse/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/../../../plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070516.jar -keyring /Users/eclipse/.eclipse_keyring -consoleLog -showlocation
